subject: Add existing yaql releases info to releases repository
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-13 08:55:43.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/_independent/yaql.yaml'], 'message': 'Add existing yaql releases info to releases repository

YAQL is an independently released library, that is used by a number of
openstack projects (murano, mistral, heat, fuel) and is already present
in global requirements. We would like to start making new yaql releases
through releases repository. This commit contains information on all non-beta
releases yaql had so far.

Depends-On: I36eba472d6795d8bc2c08cf28bf261ad2336bd9b
Change-Id: Icf5f1af7055ea947971b26ff7324a4c81ac8ea6d
'}]
commit_message:
Add existing yaql releases info to releases repository

YAQL is an independently released library, that is used by a number of
openstack projects (murano, mistral, heat, fuel) and is already present
in global requirements. We would like to start making new yaql releases
through releases repository. This commit contains information on all non-beta
releases yaql had so far.

Depends-On: I36eba472d6795d8bc2c08cf28bf261ad2336bd9b
Change-Id: Icf5f1af7055ea947971b26ff7324a4c81ac8ea6d

commit_message:
Check for existence and size of os-net-config config file

During minor update yum_update.sh always calls os-net-config
unconditionally and sometimes fails on empty config.json file.

Change-Id: If20fe2977b7bc4da9b40154e5f5bcb585a75f16e
Closes-Bug: #1666227

At the beginning, when we prepare ports for

commit_message:
Remove unused code in prepare_ports_for_replace()

At the beginning, when we prepare ports for
server replacement, we store 'fixed_ips' of
server ports before update them to []. But
update 'fixed_ips' is incorrect, we just have to
detach the ports from server. we fixed it already,
but seems the code was not cleaned.

Change-Id: If925e5bf03385922ec1784ae56ec7faff7c68b21

commit_message:
Correctly set up deprecation warning

In the current state, no warning was output in the logs.
With this fix, a warning is output in the logs and the value from
[DEFAULT] is used correctly.

Closes-Bug: #1671847

subject: Use OpenStack-Infra MariaDB mirror in OpenStack-CI
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-13 10:16:40.000000000', 'files': ['tests/roles/bootstrap-host/tasks/prepare_aio_config.yml', 'tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2'], 'message': 'Use OpenStack-Infra MariaDB mirror in OpenStack-CI

When executing tests within OpenStack-CI, the MariaDB
mirror implemented in CopenStack-Infra will be used
instead of the Rackspace mirror.

This should speed up OpenStack-CI testing and be more
reliable as it eliminates external dependencies and
does not rely on a single mirror as a source.

For the sake of record, the MariaDB mirror was
implemented in OpenStack-Infra with these reviews:

- https://review.openstack.org/307831
- https://review.openstack.org/354203
- https://review.openstack.org/440769

Change-Id: I7254bc246525488f1b94a3835786307057a906c1
'}]
commit_message:
Use OpenStack-Infra MariaDB mirror in OpenStack-CI

When executing tests within OpenStack-CI, the MariaDB
mirror implemented in CopenStack-Infra will be used
instead of the Rackspace mirror.

This should speed up OpenStack-CI testing and be more
reliable as it eliminates external dependencies and
does not rely on a single mirror as a source.

For the sake of record, the MariaDB mirror was
implemented in OpenStack-Infra with these reviews:

- https://review.openstack.org/307831
- https://review.openstack.org/354203
- https://review.openstack.org/440769

Change-Id: I7254bc246525488f1b94a3835786307057a906c1

Since for the new devstack library we still rely on some functions from

commit_message:
lib/neutron: set variables needed for sane l3 agent setup

Since for the new devstack library we still rely on some functions from
ovs_base, we need to initialize them with sane default values so that
setup works as intended and as lib/neutron-legacy behaves by default for
external connectivity setup.

Change-Id: I412ed4f988b8e03a3e3a08066375b55a6e6aa3e6

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-03 22:12:04.000000000', 'files': ['lib/glance'], 'message': "Disable glance v1 by default

Nova has been supporting glance v2 since Newton and removed
support for glance v1 in Ocata:

97e7b97210139a7f7888f0d6901e499664de02a3

We should disable glance v1 by default because there are several
test paths in Tempest which don't get run when glance v1 is
available because it uses glance v1 rather than v2.

Depends-On: I54db379f6fbe859fd9f1b0cdd5b74102539ab265

Change-Id: I7f962a07317cdad917ee896d79e49ee18938d074
"}]
commit_message:
Disable glance v1 by default

Nova has been supporting glance v2 since Newton and removed
support for glance v1 in Ocata:

97e7b97210139a7f7888f0d6901e499664de02a3

We should disable glance v1 by default because there are several
test paths in Tempest which don't get run when glance v1 is
available because it uses glance v1 rather than v2.

Depends-On: I54db379f6fbe859fd9f1b0cdd5b74102539ab265

Change-Id: I7f962a07317cdad917ee896d79e49ee18938d074

subject: manual-jobs: Enable constraint usage
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 12:12:42.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/manuals-jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'manual-jobs: Enable constraint usage

Use zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints instead of gerrit-git-prep for
manuals-jobs. These jobs might be used in repos that have constraints
enabled - like openstackdocstheme - and thus need the constraints file
downloaded. Also, we can use the zuul setup macro now on all notes, use
it for better git tree set up.

Change-Id: I965d7d1abb5e8fba0e54146b2d828a04da851bb7
'}]
commit_message:
manual-jobs: Enable constraint usage

Use zuul-git-prep-upper-constraints instead of gerrit-git-prep for
manuals-jobs. These jobs might be used in repos that have constraints
enabled - like openstackdocstheme - and thus need the constraints file
downloaded. Also, we can use the zuul setup macro now on all notes, use
it for better git tree set up.

Change-Id: I965d7d1abb5e8fba0e54146b2d828a04da851bb7

commit_message:
upgrade sphinx and turn warnings to errors

Update to the version of Sphinx that supports treating warnings as
errors through setup.cfg, and turn on that flag. Fix the warnings that
prevent the build from working in this state.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
default deliverable type to other in sort

The validation job now requires type to be set, but we have several old
deliverables without it. Rather than edit all of them, set the default
to 'other' to avoid comparing None with a string.

Change-Id: I4e5a1d5f19dac8f6253bc7d6d040e1869c004d08
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

Upgrades: wait for galera to be settled

We also need to wait for the galera resource to settle down
before we proceed starting up with the other services.

change in ansible-pacemaker:
https://review.gerrithub.io/#/c/351387/

The only reason we have a dependency on launchpadlib and
lazr.restfulclient is for the old tool that imported project history
from launchpad. We no longer need the tool, so we can remove it and the
dependency as part of our python 3 port.

commit_message:
remove unused tool with launchpadlib dependency

The only reason we have a dependency on launchpadlib and
lazr.restfulclient is for the old tool that imported project history
from launchpad. We no longer need the tool, so we can remove it and the
dependency as part of our python 3 port.

Change-Id: Ie87e6172c953df10cb70d34c9bc23ad30e97ce4d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Strip white space from instance names

Launching instances with names having white spaces
cause extremely long error messages from nova.
It makes sense to strip white spaces from instance
names. Added a clean method to check instance name
input validation.
Added a testcase to test this scenario.

Change-Id: Ic0844d967d519f57246b8220f9a863faf85351d2
Closes-Bug: #1519386

commit_message:
UX: Single Step Workflows should be handled differently

Single Step Workflows shouldn't even be treated as workflows.
It wastes space and looks strange.  Legacy workflows have
already been made to function with a single step.

A different in markup was noted and fixed between the legacy
and Angular views.

Change-Id: Id6652e5c275621b22eca7ec42add321988430860
Closes-bug: #1593001

subject: Aligning the legacy workflows with the new modern workflows.
revisions:
[{'number': 14, 'created': '2016-09-16 21:13:00.000000000', 'files': ['horizon/templates/horizon/common/modern/_workflow_step.html', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/wizard/wizard.html', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/modern/_workflow.html', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/aggregates/workflows.py', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/modern/_workflow_step_update_members.html', 'horizon/workflows/base.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/aggregates/views.py', 'horizon/workflows/views.py', 'horizon/templates/horizon/common/modern/_workflow_base.html', 'horizon/workflows/__init__.py'], 'message': "Aligning the legacy workflows with the new modern workflows.

Though it has been deprecated, Legacy Launch Instance was the clear
choice in the first workflow to tackle, because it exists in a modern
form now, that can easily be compared against the legacy for
functionality and evolution of layout. Legacy templates have been
left in place to allow existing workflows to continue to work until
they can be updated and any plugins that might be making use of it.
Nuances: Legacy workflows only had a concept of 'help text' which
was allotted the entire 1/2 of the modal window at all times. The
workflows are now responsive with toggle navigation for small
screens.

Modern workflows have 3 concepts of 'help text':
 * Step Description - above the form
 * Help Block - hidden in the help panel
 * Extras - Graphs and other useful information that takes up 1/4
   of the modal width when used.

Single Step Workflows have no need for a right nav pill experience,
if only a single step exists, then the form consumes the entire modal
space.

partial-bug: #1570482
partial-bug: #1593001

Change-Id: I89385907a2755b0608c96a7f48333f2da72bd789
"}]
commit_message:
Aligning the legacy workflows with the new modern workflows.

Though it has been deprecated, Legacy Launch Instance was the clear
choice in the first workflow to tackle, because it exists in a modern
form now, that can easily be compared against the legacy for
functionality and evolution of layout. Legacy templates have been
left in place to allow existing workflows to continue to work until
they can be updated and any plugins that might be making use of it.
Nuances: Legacy workflows only had a concept of 'help text' which
was allotted the entire 1/2 of the modal window at all times. The
workflows are now responsive with toggle navigation for small
screens.

Modern workflows have 3 concepts of 'help text':
 * Step Description - above the form
 * Help Block - hidden in the help panel
 * Extras - Graphs and other useful information that takes up 1/4
   of the modal width when used.

Single Step Workflows have no need for a right nav pill experience,
if only a single step exists, then the form consumes the entire modal
space.

partial-bug: #1570482
partial-bug: #1593001

Change-Id: I89385907a2755b0608c96a7f48333f2da72bd789

subject: Try to keep container_format across image update
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-02-10 01:59:55.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/views.py', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/images/images/forms.py'], 'message': 'Try to keep container_format across image update

Currently the update and creation of a Glance image share the same
logic in image metadata generation. In particular, the container_format
value is always deduced from the image_format, effectively discarding
whatever the existing value was during image update.

This commit retains the original container_format value across image
update, if the image format does not change; otherwise it fallbacks to
the existing deduction logic.

Change-Id: I9b80ecddf2c5f1c2173b2465595f0c3f614b52c6
Closes-Bug: 1539722
'}]
commit_message:
Try to keep container_format across image update

Currently the update and creation of a Glance image share the same
logic in image metadata generation. In particular, the container_format
value is always deduced from the image_format, effectively discarding
whatever the existing value was during image update.

This commit retains the original container_format value across image
update, if the image format does not change; otherwise it fallbacks to
the existing deduction logic.

Change-Id: I9b80ecddf2c5f1c2173b2465595f0c3f614b52c6
Closes-Bug: 1539722

commit_message:
TrivialFix: Do not use synchronous_reader argument

While running the following was observed in the captured stderr:

neutron/tests/unit/testlib_api.py:104: DeprecationWarning: Using the
'synchronous_reader' argument is deprecated: argument value is
propagated from the parent _TransactionFactory
      synchronous_reader=True)

I simply removed the argument.

The parent ref is here and defaults to True:
https://github.com/openstack/oslo.db/blob/master/oslo_db/sqlalchemy/enginefacade.py#L160

TrivialFix

Change-Id: Ic1744d97edb69b0f806aea7f2cde0b89b6bfbce1

subject: Do not try to show L3 agent action when enable_router is False
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 08:59:19.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/info/tables.py'], 'message': "Do not try to show L3 agent action when enable_router is False

When enable_router settings is False, 'routers' panel is not
registered and URL resolver of L3 agent action in the network
agent table will result in a failure.
As a result, System Information panel cannot be displayed.

This commit adds a check whether the router panel is enabled or not.

Change-Id: I67aba79f61870b093d4c1d9c7527003704483d50
Closes-Bug: #1671785
"}]
commit_message:
Do not try to show L3 agent action when enable_router is False

When enable_router settings is False, 'routers' panel is not
registered and URL resolver of L3 agent action in the network
agent table will result in a failure.
As a result, System Information panel cannot be displayed.

This commit adds a check whether the router panel is enabled or not.

Change-Id: I67aba79f61870b093d4c1d9c7527003704483d50
Closes-Bug: #1671785

subject: Handle the case that the time is zero
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-12 00:40:03.000000000', 'files': ['zun/common/utils.py', 'zun/tests/tempest/api/test_containers.py', 'zun/container/docker/driver.py', 'zun/objects/fields.py', 'zun/objects/container.py', 'zun/tests/unit/container/docker/test_docker_driver.py', 'zun/tests/unit/objects/test_fields.py', 'zun/tests/unit/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': 'Handle the case that the time is zero

If a container is created but not started yet, the "StartedAt" field
of the Docker container will be January 1, year 1, 00:00:00 UTC.
This commit will check for this case and print "Created" to the
status_detail field.

Depends-On: I6185e3b8fc5e5b132656ff416e08917edd938fc8
Change-Id: If3eca41e52f32dddb9cbc34d64fdc931e1d219e6
'}]
commit_message:
Handle the case that the time is zero

If a container is created but not started yet, the "StartedAt" field
of the Docker container will be January 1, year 1, 00:00:00 UTC.
This commit will check for this case and print "Created" to the
status_detail field.

Depends-On: I6185e3b8fc5e5b132656ff416e08917edd938fc8
Change-Id: If3eca41e52f32dddb9cbc34d64fdc931e1d219e6

subject: Get "zun cp" command to work
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 23:04:17.000000000', 'files': ['zunclient/v1/containers_shell.py', 'zunclient/tests/unit/v1/test_containers.py', 'zunclient/osc/v1/containers.py', 'zunclient/v1/containers.py'], 'message': 'Get "zun cp" command to work

The cp command didn't work because the API (get_archive/put_archive)
expect a tarfile but the CLI send/receive a raw file. This commit
did the following:
* Package the source file into a tarball before calling put_archive
* Untar the file returned by get_archive

Change-Id: I296054c26a8cd3e098967b777f6ff061fbd6c3cf
'}]
commit_message:
Get "zun cp" command to work

The cp command didn't work because the API (get_archive/put_archive)
expect a tarfile but the CLI send/receive a raw file. This commit
did the following:
* Package the source file into a tarball before calling put_archive

Henderson', 'email': 'kyleh@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'kyleh'}, {'_account_id': 13562, 'name': 'Samuel Matzek', 'email': 'smatzek@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'smatzek'}, {'_account_id': 14806, 'name': 'Chhavi Agarwal', 'email': 'chhagarw@in.ibm.com', 'username': 'chhagarw'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-06 11:37:14.000000000', 'files': ['templates/proxy-server.conf.j2', 'releasenotes/notes/capping_swift_services_workers-5ac9ecb28f56469f.yaml', 'defaults/main.yml'], 'message': "Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads. However when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs. Capping only swift proxy server
worker threads when the proxy is in a container. Not capping the
remaining swift services' workers because of the performance impact
it may cause because of the capping.

Change-Id: I12d930552558144ab49fecc0b3776747c1f02166
"}]
commit_message:
Cap the number of worker threads

Users can configure the number of worker threads. However when it's
not specified the calculated number of workers can get too large on
hosts with a large number of CPUs. Capping only swift proxy server
worker threads when the proxy is in a container. Not capping the
remaining swift services' workers because of the performance impact
it may cause because of the capping.

Change-Id: I12d930552558144ab49fecc0b3776747c1f02166

commit_message:
[operations-guide] Signed images update

In the User-Facing Operations section in Operations Guide, the
"Adding Signed Images" instructions need some additional steps
to indicate how to handle the case when Keystone is located
remotely. The image signing character limit also needs to be added.

Co-Authored-By: chenxing <chen.xing@99cloud.net>
Change-Id: I54608ec58bba486aa1420f641607cc8e8449f472
Closes-Bug: 1671944

constructor instead of doing it on module import.

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2017-03-10 07:22:35.000000000', 'files': ['docker/sahara/sahara-base/Dockerfile.j2'], 'message': 'Sahara needs to run ssh-keygen

In order to generate keypair and access to cluster instances,
sahara-base container must include this binary, even when we

Change-Id: I40747bceba3fede66864b781df1da1034ea22d11
Closes-Bug: #1665293

commit_message:
Sahara needs to run ssh-keygen

In order to generate keypair and access to cluster instances,
sahara-base container must include this binary, even when we
deploy based on source type.

Change-Id: I40747bceba3fede66864b781df1da1034ea22d11
Closes-Bug: #1665293

commit_message:
Various python3 fixes

I tried running disk-image-create under python3 and found a few
issues.  This is the result of running 2to3.  The only critical one is
in block_device/blockdevice.py which is an actual error as keys()[0]
doesn't work but the rest seem sensible enough to do as well.

Change-Id: Idef5f4362f032b76dd6124a810a7780760135a0c

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib data_utils - identity

Tempest has duplicated modules of data_utils, one is tempest.lib and
the other is tempest.common. The difference is tempest.common module
refers to the config option resources_prefix. And the option is marked
as deprecated already. So it is nice to replace the calls with tempest.lib
one.

Change-Id: Ibd98d212ae4fc2d581ad944cc004addee77e4281

subject: vnfd-delete gives ambiguous success message
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-13 09:35:00.000000000', 'files': ['tackerclient/tacker/v1_0/__init__.py', 'tackerclient/tests/unit/test_cli10.py'], 'message': 'vnfd-delete gives ambiguous success message

When a single vnfd is deleted, the following success message is delivered.

$> tacker vnfd-delete cirros-vnfd-multi-vdu

All vnfd(s) deleted successfully

The above success message has to modified to
" All specified %(resource)s(s) %(msg)s successfully? "

Change-Id: I48443622b718a1d6a1476f53c6378b67ce0d82e4
Closes-Bug: #1672302
'}]
commit_message:
vnfd-delete gives ambiguous success message

When a single vnfd is deleted, the following success message is delivered.

$> tacker vnfd-delete cirros-vnfd-multi-vdu

All vnfd(s) deleted successfully

The above success message has to modified to
" All specified %(resource)s(s) %(msg)s successfully? "

Change-Id: I48443622b718a1d6a1476f53c6378b67ce0d82e4
Closes-Bug: #1672302

subject: Refresh devstack testing docs.
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-10 18:44:08.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/testing.rst'], 'message': 'Refresh devstack testing docs.

One big difference is that we create both a public and private network
by default.  The previous docs only showed a private network.

Update most commands to use the openstack client instead of the older
project specific clients.

Add a section on allocating a floating IP address so that you can
connect to the VMs.

Change-Id: I48850d87db1843fcea0ff00074c6cd17980a39f1
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Refresh devstack testing docs.

One big difference is that we create both a public and private network
by default.  The previous docs only showed a private network.

Update most commands to use the openstack client instead of the older
project specific clients.

Add a section on allocating a floating IP address so that you can
connect to the VMs.

Change-Id: I48850d87db1843fcea0ff00074c6cd17980a39f1
Signed-off-by: Russell Bryant <rbryant@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib data_utils - compute

Tempest has duplicated modules of data_utils, one is tempest.lib and
the other is tempest.common. The difference is tempest.common module
refers to the config option resources_prefix. And the option is marked
as deprecated already. So it is nice to replace the calls with tempest.lib
one.

Change-Id: Idfa9824d14a1e5e4291fcb70bb2c00caf9083d67

commit_message:
Use tempest.lib data_utils - scenario

Tempest has duplicated modules of data_utils, one is tempest.lib and
the other is tempest.common. The difference is tempest.common module
refers to the config option resources_prefix. And the option is marked
as deprecated already. So it is nice to replace the calls with tempest.lib
one.

Change-Id: Ifffa05bb80b0d09b19bf2ecca0009c27642b9959

commit_message:
Add RemoteClient under tempest.lib

remote_client under tempest.common is used in many projects but the
module is not defined as stable. This patch adds the essential part
of the module into tempest.lib as stable interface.

Change-Id: Idb2206c239f25bc8b8530275e84c834233b9544b

commit_message:
Move plugin client registration to proxy

The plugin client registration is triggered to early, which leads
to the CONF object being initialised twice. Moving the plugin
client registration to live together with the tempest own client
registration.

Change-Id: I7c15e8c5ee9c7421ac410cfaa84b3ce21380f5e7

commit_message:
Fixup python 3 compatibility for subprocess calls

check_output needs to be decoded in py3 environments; provide
a helper wrapper function todo this + update unit tests to deal
with this slightly different approach to UTF-8 decoding.

commit_message:
Bugfix: Forbid colon in dimension name

Monasca-Agent http_check plugin creates
dimensions which contain multiple colon:
url:http://192.168.10.4:5601

This bugfix makes it possible to query for
metrics with such dimensions. Until now an
exception was thrown.

Closes-Bug: 1668937
Change-Id: I39ed6fba99491630f6a7e0c67743b807e3529461

commit_message:
Add recipe to deploy Compute service placement-api

The placement-api has been added by nova for the Newton cycle, it has
become mandatory for Ocata.

It is deployed as a wsgi app similar to what we have for keystone and
gnocchi already.

Change-Id: I1d1f1cc7046cb30a91894a0c884bc861d7f3dd95

commit_message:
Support check before do node-recover action

This patch add a parameter 'check' to node-recover command.
Then user could choice whether check physical resource status before do
node-recover action.
partial-blueprint: refresh-status-before-do-node-recover

Change-Id: I94e33351593ffc49458ad85abde8acba5dc972e9

commit_message:
Add specifications directory

The Blazar project doesn't have a separate specs repository. If Blazar
users want to know details of new features, they need to follow IRC
discussions or track Git commits.

This patch creates a directory to keep specifications publicly visible.

Change-Id: I34918fe34d331d690b18b27a7d470f093d211cf7
Closes-Bug: #1670956

commit_message:
Disable some network panels if settings are False

There are some network panels can still be accessed by
directly input url. For instance, vpn and firewalls panel,
though the local_settings file has the following settings:
  'enable_firewall': False,
  'enable_vpn': False.
This patch will disable those network panels if
OPENSTACK_NEUTRON_NETWORK settings are False.

Change-Id: I11ab17b55e8d39d0986992b692302a24601f8f7c

commit_message:
Expand libvirt and ovs plugins to publish entity names

This is useful in dashboards where we display libvirt and ovs
metrics for a physical host, it will elimnate the step of translating
vm and tenant ids if needing to investigate project usage.

The libvirt plugin metadata config array will now support
'vm_name' and 'tenant_name', and the ovs plugin will now
support the metadata config value for 'tenant_name'.

Change-Id: If76418b83119a12b8534fb7f7cb224339f357be8

subject: [WIP]Improve error messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-10-11 11:07:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/openstack-service-api/swift.service.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/toast/toast.html', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/toast/toast.service.js'], 'message': '[WIP]Improve error messages

At the moment, many error message displayed in horizon are just "Unable to xxx ".
However it's so unuseful because a user can not know what happened.
I think users would not be able to do proper action without any help.
Thus, this patch will display a message returned by api(pythonclient) and so on.
These message may have a possibility not to relate with an operation on horizon directly.
And it is not translated. However, it might be some help for users to know about an error.

Change-Id: Iaf2837192926851fa9b602e80c7930ad3df23279
'}]
commit_message:
[WIP]Improve error messages

At the moment, many error message displayed in horizon are just "Unable to xxx ".
However it's so unuseful because a user can not know what happened.
I think users would not be able to do proper action without any help.
Thus, this patch will display a message returned by api(pythonclient) and so on.
These message may have a possibility not to relate with an operation on horizon directly.
And it is not translated. However, it might be some help for users to know about an error.

Change-Id: Iaf2837192926851fa9b602e80c7930ad3df23279

subject: Add a new scenario only multinode gate job
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2017-03-10 14:23:31.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/devstack-gate.yaml'], 'message': 'Add a new scenario only multinode gate job

This job is an attempt to reduce the load in the SUT in the gate,
by splitting API and tempest tests in two separate jobs, and by
running scenario ("heavier") tests in a dedicate job serially.

We already stopped running a number of scenario tests from the
main gate so we need this job at least for tempest to make sure
other scenario tests are not bit rotting.

This job is non voting for now.

Change-Id: I11eb21686351a98e55fecc15a794397da6d92b40
'}]
commit_message:
Add a new scenario only multinode gate job

This job is an attempt to reduce the load in the SUT in the gate,
by splitting API and tempest tests in two separate jobs, and by
running scenario ("heavier") tests in a dedicate job serially.

We already stopped running a number of scenario tests from the
main gate so we need this job at least for tempest to make sure
other scenario tests are not bit rotting.

This job is non voting for now.

Change-Id: I11eb21686351a98e55fecc15a794397da6d92b40

subject: Reload sshd on centos for allow-local-ssh-root
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 21:13:20.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/macros.yaml'], 'message': 'Reload sshd on centos for allow-local-ssh-root

We are seeing some issues restarting SSHD for centos.  Because we are
doing config file changes, and SSHD is running, we can use the reload
command.

Reload is a little different then restart, specifically reload does a
SIGUP on the process. In some local testing, this seems to be more
reliable to restart, which causes some bind address errors.

Change-Id: Ic5e00e1e1eed1de87c430180a6f00d30410a95b4
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Reload sshd on centos for allow-local-ssh-root

We are seeing some issues restarting SSHD for centos.  Because we are
doing config file changes, and SSHD is running, we can use the reload
command.

Reload is a little different then restart, specifically reload does a
SIGUP on the process. In some local testing, this seems to be more
reliable to restart, which causes some bind address errors.

Change-Id: Ic5e00e1e1eed1de87c430180a6f00d30410a95b4
Signed-off-by: Paul Belanger <pabelanger@redhat.com>

subject: Adds python-hnvclient repository
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2017-03-06 11:58:05.000000000', 'files': ['gerritbot/channels.yaml', 'jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'gerrit/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml', 'gerrit/acls/openstack/python-hnvclient.config'], 'message': 'Adds python-hnvclient repository

Windows / Hyper-V Server 2016 introduced a new Network Controller
server role, which can be controlled through a REST API [1].

The new Network Controller introduces new features for Hyper-V, such
as VXLAN support, Software Load Balancer, RAS Gateway management.

python-hnvclient offers a client that can interact with the
Network Controller through its REST API, and it will be used in order
to bring the mentioned new features into OpenStack [2].

Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/python-hnvclient
Pypi: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hnv

[1] https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn859239.aspx
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-hyperv/+spec/hyperv-network-virtualization-support

Change-Id: I5994fefd99d9504e73a8bd0e231153858e4a2251
'}]
commit_message:
Adds python-hnvclient repository

Windows / Hyper-V Server 2016 introduced a new Network Controller
server role, which can be controlled through a REST API [1].

The new Network Controller introduces new features for Hyper-V, such
as VXLAN support, Software Load Balancer, RAS Gateway management.

python-hnvclient offers a client that can interact with the
Network Controller through its REST API, and it will be used in order
to bring the mentioned new features into OpenStack [2].

Launchpad: https://launchpad.net/python-hnvclient
Pypi: https://pypi.python.org/pypi/hnv

[1] https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/dn859239.aspx
[2] https://blueprints.launchpad.net/networking-hyperv/+spec/hyperv-network-virtualization-support

Change-Id: I5994fefd99d9504e73a8bd0e231153858e4a2251

commit_message:
Add os_molteniron to OpenStack-Ansible

This patch adds new pre-seeded git repository to OpenStack-Ansible for
deploying Molteniron.

This project will have its own core team with the general
openstack-ansible core team included, with the appropriate rights to
ensure that they can act as a back-stop in case of any issues.

Needed-By: Ie7190e6d46091ff91b108baf48ecf5d304885124
Change-Id: Ib60593085179819e566068576be08ee403221d22

commit_message:
Fix internal tempest tests

Existing methods - wait_for_volume_status,
wait_for_snapshot_status and wait_for_backup_status
were combined into
wait_for_volume_resource_status.

This patch is intended to fix the issue occured
due to above change.

Change-Id: Iaf1fd19a3fdf50aec8aaddffdcbaf6d0466fbd35
Closes-bug:1667448
(cherry picked from commit beca6c147ce67f7d7c417070ae921106625a2354)

subject: Add Swift tox functional EC env tests to gate
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-13 06:34:35.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/jobs/projects.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': "Add Swift tox functional EC env tests to gate

A new toxenv enviroment has been added to the Swift repo 'func-ec'
which will run the swift functional tests on an EC policy:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/442749/

This patch added this toxenv as a check/gate job so we can be sure to
gate on EC better. Initially voting will be off just to be sure it's
working correctly.

As this toxenv only existing currently in master, and therefore only
future stable branches, current stable branches are filtered out.

Change-Id: I037c622e1e96d8790e0e9788e6485fcb06ab68a1
"}]
commit_message:
Add Swift tox functional EC env tests to gate

A new toxenv enviroment has been added to the Swift repo 'func-ec'
which will run the swift functional tests on an EC policy:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/442749/

This patch added this toxenv as a check/gate job so we can be sure to
gate on EC better. Initially voting will be off just to be sure it's
working correctly.

As this toxenv only existing currently in master, and therefore only
future stable branches, current stable branches are filtered out.

Change-Id: I037c622e1e96d8790e0e9788e6485fcb06ab68a1

commit_message:
Support check before do cluster-recover action

This patch add a parameter 'check' to cluster-recover command.
User could choice whether check the status of nodes that belong to
the cluster before do cluster-recover action.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 16:19:29.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py', 'shade/exc.py'], 'message': "Raise a more specific exception on nova 400 errors

We may want to take some actions in nodepool, such as cache
invalidation, when we specifically get BadRequest errors. We may not,
but throwing the more specific exception doesn't hurt.

Change-Id: I748519daba2781bf83d6dc0151a1c12dd12d0e3f

commit_message:
Raise a more specific exception on nova 400 errors

We may want to take some actions in nodepool, such as cache
invalidation, when we specifically get BadRequest errors. We may not,
but throwing the more specific exception doesn't hurt.

Change-Id: I748519daba2781bf83d6dc0151a1c12dd12d0e3f

subject: Only do fnmatch compilation and logging once per loop
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 14:42:07.000000000', 'files': ['shade/_utils.py'], 'message': "Only do fnmatch compilation and logging once per loop

We don't need to compile the fnmatch regex in every loop pass - so
compile it at the top of the loop. Also, logging about a bad regex on
every loop is silly. Only log if we don't have a match at the end.

Change-Id: Iffa039237042d6a2f75aa08f2c949d508b367ec4
"}]
commit_message:
Only do fnmatch compilation and logging once per loop

We don't need to compile the fnmatch regex in every loop pass - so
compile it at the top of the loop. Also, logging about a bad regex on
every loop is silly. Only log if we don't have a match at the end.

Change-Id: Iffa039237042d6a2f75aa08f2c949d508b367ec4

subject: Put fnmatch code back, but safely this time
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-09 14:50:31.000000000', 'files': ['shade/tests/unit/test__utils.py', 'shade/_utils.py'], 'message': "Put fnmatch code back, but safely this time

If we do a strict equality test FIRST, then the fnmatch, then we don't
have to remove the fnmatch functionality, but we should also be able to
match normal names with wildcards in them.

This reverts commit 0ecbb22547c470fca6d50cfad2ee94e1241f83f4.

Change-Id: Ibc08cc09e0e3db2e194f1b8d0cf98c08500d87c5
"}]
commit_message:
Put fnmatch code back, but safely this time

If we do a strict equality test FIRST, then the fnmatch, then we don't
have to remove the fnmatch functionality, but we should also be able to
match normal names with wildcards in them.

This reverts commit 0ecbb22547c470fca6d50cfad2ee94e1241f83f4.

Change-Id: Ibc08cc09e0e3db2e194f1b8d0cf98c08500d87c5

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-12-01 09:45:48.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/hpe/test_hpe3par.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/hpe/hpe_3par_common.py'], 'message': '3PAR: Fix performance issue with volume cloning

If size of source and target volume mismatch
  - create a destination volume of size equivalent to source volume
  - copy the contents of source volume to destination volume
  - Grow the destination volume equivalent to requested size

On 3PAR array this gives a good response times for copy operation
rather than doing these following operations
  - creating destination volume equivalent to the requested size
  - copy the contents of source volume to destination volume

Change-Id: Iccdd4108d519b8bc0d6bb5bc691241e51b0d4264
Closes-Bug: #1645136
'}]
commit_message:
3PAR: Fix performance issue with volume cloning

If size of source and target volume mismatch
  - create a destination volume of size equivalent to source volume
  - copy the contents of source volume to destination volume
  - Grow the destination volume equivalent to requested size

On 3PAR array this gives a good response times for copy operation
rather than doing these following operations
  - creating destination volume equivalent to the requested size
  - copy the contents of source volume to destination volume

Change-Id: Iccdd4108d519b8bc0d6bb5bc691241e51b0d4264
Closes-Bug: #1645136

revisions:
[{'number': 46, 'created': '2016-10-16 17:19:35.000000000', 'files': ['trove/common/notification.py', 'trove/taskmanager/manager.py', 'devstack/plugin.sh', 'trove/tests/unittests/common/test_single_tenant_remote.py', 'trove/common/single_tenant_remote.py'], 'message': "Fix for 'Client' object has no attribute 'tenants'

publish_quota_notifications method was implemented in
trove/taskmanager/manager.py as implementation part of
'Ceilometer Integration' blueprint [1] in mitaka with the patch[2].

The 'dbaas.quotas' notification will be periodically emitted to reflect
the current state of utilization of the Trove quotas. The frequency of
notification events will be defined by the quota_notification_interval
configuration value in trove-taskmanager.conf file.

Each time taskmanager is failing to prepare 'dbaas.quotas' notification
with an error 'Client object has no attribute tenants' and the root
cause for the failure is publish_quota_notifications method is trying
to get tenant list using 'novaclient' instead of using 'keystoneclient'

This patch includes following enhancements.

1. Customized devstack/plugin.sh to have correct nova admin credentials
   in all the trove configuration files.

2. Implemented new keystone_client_trove_admin method in
   trove/common/single_tenant_remote.py to prepare the keystoneclient
   using the nova admin credentials from trove-taskmanager.

3. Enhanced the publish_quota_notifications method in
   trove/taskmanager/manager.py to get the tenant list using keystone
   client.

4. Included tenant_id in 'dbaas.quotas' notification payload.

5. Removed admin_token from the context, so that notication will not
   have admin_token details.

6. Unittest for keystone_client_trove_admin method in
   trove/tests/unittests/common/test_single_tenant_remote.py

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/trove-specs/specs/mitaka/ceilometer-integration.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/227870

Change-Id: Ief1e5f2a1f3c97c050043e5fb05b86476886c1f3
Closes-Bug: #1600485
"}]
commit_message:
Fix for 'Client' object has no attribute 'tenants'

publish_quota_notifications method was implemented in
trove/taskmanager/manager.py as implementation part of
'Ceilometer Integration' blueprint [1] in mitaka with the patch[2].

The 'dbaas.quotas' notification will be periodically emitted to reflect
the current state of utilization of the Trove quotas. The frequency of
notification events will be defined by the quota_notification_interval
configuration value in trove-taskmanager.conf file.

Each time taskmanager is failing to prepare 'dbaas.quotas' notification
with an error 'Client object has no attribute tenants' and the root
cause for the failure is publish_quota_notifications method is trying
to get tenant list using 'novaclient' instead of using 'keystoneclient'

This patch includes following enhancements.

1. Customized devstack/plugin.sh to have correct nova admin credentials
   in all the trove configuration files.

2. Implemented new keystone_client_trove_admin method in
   trove/common/single_tenant_remote.py to prepare the keystoneclient
   using the nova admin credentials from trove-taskmanager.

3. Enhanced the publish_quota_notifications method in
   trove/taskmanager/manager.py to get the tenant list using keystone
   client.

4. Included tenant_id in 'dbaas.quotas' notification payload.

5. Removed admin_token from the context, so that notication will not
   have admin_token details.

6. Unittest for keystone_client_trove_admin method in
   trove/tests/unittests/common/test_single_tenant_remote.py

[1] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/trove-specs/specs/mitaka/ceilometer-integration.html
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/227870

Change-Id: Ief1e5f2a1f3c97c050043e5fb05b86476886c1f3
Closes-Bug: #1600485

commit_message:
Route datasource add/delete request to datasource node

API request adding/deleting datasource should be routed to datasource
node, and then the datasource node creates/removes the requested
datasource during the request. It enables user to use the datasource
just after recieving the response of request.

Change-Id: If365c6d1db9ecc5c578421ad5c362326fc262a78
Closes-bug: #1638729
Closes-bug: #1639116

subject: Exclude atomic rule from dependency graph
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-20 20:49:16.000000000', 'files': ['congress/tests/policy_engines/test_agnostic.py', 'congress/datalog/compile.py'], 'message': 'Exclude atomic rule from dependency graph

Dependency graph used by agnostic excludes positive literals
of type compile.Literal. But when a policy is deleted, the facts
in the policy are deleted as atomic rules of type compile.Rule. As
a result, some nodes in the dependency graph are prematurely deleted
because the deleting of facts (type compile.Rule) via policy delete
decreased ref counters that had not been correspondingly increased
by the adding of those same facts (type compile.Literal). When a
dependency graph is thus corrupted, congress gives Internal Server
Error on all future attempts to add/delete/sync rules.

This patch fixes the problem by having agnostic treat an atomic rule
(type compile.Rule) the same way it treats an atom
(type compile.Literal) in the dependency graph -- ignore both.

Closes-Bug: 1662809

Change-Id: I8080cbb7c375d90259f7b8a2a62d714ebe4aee5f
'}]
commit_message:
Exclude atomic rule from dependency graph

Dependency graph used by agnostic excludes positive literals
of type compile.Literal. But when a policy is deleted, the facts
in the policy are deleted as atomic rules of type compile.Rule. As
a result, some nodes in the dependency graph are prematurely deleted
because the deleting of facts (type compile.Rule) via policy delete
decreased ref counters that had not been correspondingly increased
by the adding of those same facts (type compile.Literal). When a
dependency graph is thus corrupted, congress gives Internal Server
Error on all future attempts to add/delete/sync rules.

This patch fixes the problem by having agnostic treat an atomic rule
(type compile.Rule) the same way it treats an atom
(type compile.Literal) in the dependency graph -- ignore both.

Closes-Bug: 1662809

Change-Id: I8080cbb7c375d90259f7b8a2a62d714ebe4aee5f

subject: Do not init data on subscribe for unresponsive service
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-02-20 23:44:26.000000000', 'files': ['congress/dse2/data_service.py', 'congress/tests/dse2/test_dse2.py'], 'message': 'Do not init data on subscribe for unresponsive service

The initializing to empty causes agnostic to delete policy facts
when the service is a regular policy. This change forgoes the
initialization. Does not affect evaluation because when there is no
data, evaluation defaults to False/empty.

Closes-Bug: 1666325
Change-Id: I879b73eab8a6a083a9fb47bef09abe5ee398f949
(cherry picked from commit 03c9dddec5be22f88effa25d8ce0001f63907e3f)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not init data on subscribe for unresponsive service

The initializing to empty causes agnostic to delete policy facts
when the service is a regular policy. This change forgoes the
initialization. Does not affect evaluation because when there is no
data, evaluation defaults to False/empty.

Closes-Bug: 1666325
Change-Id: I879b73eab8a6a083a9fb47bef09abe5ee398f949
(cherry picked from commit 03c9dddec5be22f88effa25d8ce0001f63907e3f)

commit_message:
Bump API microversion to 1.6

This patch bumps the API micro-version to 1.6 for the following changes:

- A 'profile-only' parameter has been added to cluster-update API.
- A 'check' parameter is now acceptable to the cluster-recover API.
- A 'check' parameter is now acceptable to the node-recover API.

Change-Id: Iece1e5a1b64c2a389c4d327737c7c097a7595cd6

subject: Enable router az and simplify net topology
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-03-08 12:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['tricircle/xjob/xmanager.py', 'releasenotes/notes/enable-router-az-and-simplify-net-topology-5ac8739b167e3e4a.yaml', 'tricircle/common/exceptions.py', 'tricircle/network/helper.py', 'tricircle/tests/unit/network/test_central_plugin.py', 'tricircle/network/central_plugin.py'], 'message': "Enable router az and simplify net topology

1. What is the problem
1) Tricircle does not enable router's az
2) Tricircle's network topology is too complex for local
router(router reside only in one region)
2. What is the solution to the problem
1) Enable router's az
2) Remove ns-router and bridge network when used local router

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
1)Enable router's az
2)Attach external network to local router directly, no additional
intermediate router is needed.

Implements: blueprint enable-router-az-simplify-net-top
Change-Id: I410a81c9d0e56db8163e611211b8dbd4c5772767
"}]
commit_message:
Enable router az and simplify net topology

1. What is the problem
1) Tricircle does not enable router's az
2) Tricircle's network topology is too complex for local
router(router reside only in one region)
2. What is the solution to the problem
1) Enable router's az
2) Remove ns-router and bridge network when used local router

3. What the features need to be implemented to the Tricircle
1)Enable router's az
2)Attach external network to local router directly, no additional
intermediate router is needed.

Implements: blueprint enable-router-az-simplify-net-top
Change-Id: I410a81c9d0e56db8163e611211b8dbd4c5772767

subject: Fix dib-init-system for Debian Jessie and Debian Stretch
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2017-03-11 14:04:15.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/dib-init-system_fix_for_debian_jessie-c6f7261ee84dad27.yaml', 'diskimage_builder/elements/dib-init-system/dib-init-system'], 'message': 'Fix dib-init-system for Debian Jessie and Debian Stretch

On Debian Jessie and Debian Stretch systemctl is in /bin.
If the package systemd-sysv is not installed the script
dib-init-system did not find the init system.
This patch fixes the problem: it also looks in /bin
for systemctl and if found decides for systemd.

Change-Id: I5a18052a070bad5e16b14672237a1e2b38513949
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dib-init-system for Debian Jessie and Debian Stretch

On Debian Jessie and Debian Stretch systemctl is in /bin.
If the package systemd-sysv is not installed the script
dib-init-system did not find the init system.
This patch fixes the problem: it also looks in /bin
for systemctl and if found decides for systemd.

Change-Id: I5a18052a070bad5e16b14672237a1e2b38513949
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

subject: Send custom parameters in bootloader to GRUB_CMDLINE
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-08 14:43:59.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/finalise.d/50-bootloader', 'diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/environment.d/10-bootloader-default-cmdline', 'diskimage_builder/elements/bootloader/README.rst'], 'message': "Send custom parameters in bootloader to GRUB_CMDLINE

Depending on the types of deployment (security, nfv...) some extra
kernel flags are needed on the images. This change exposes the
DIB_BOOTLOADER_DEFAULT_CMDLINE parameter, defaulting to the
existing 'nofb nomodeset vga=normal', that will allow to modify
these boot params.

Change-Id: I67d191fa5ca44a57f776cb9739a02dd71212969c
Closes-Bug: #1668890
"}]
commit_message:
Send custom parameters in bootloader to GRUB_CMDLINE

Depending on the types of deployment (security, nfv...) some extra
kernel flags are needed on the images. This change exposes the
DIB_BOOTLOADER_DEFAULT_CMDLINE parameter, defaulting to the
existing 'nofb nomodeset vga=normal', that will allow to modify
these boot params.

Change-Id: I67d191fa5ca44a57f776cb9739a02dd71212969c
Closes-Bug: #1668890

commit_message:
Introduce Guru to Zaqar

Guru is a mechanism whereby developers
and system administrators can generate
a report about the state of a running
Zaqar executable.

This report is called a *Guru Meditation Report*

This mechanism will help developer or operator
to fix issues in (production) deployments without
stopping Zaqar service.

Implements: blueprint introduce-guru-to-zaqar
Change-Id: I72885be396be7eb0a9dd8fd564d706a8351b02c6

commit_message:
Use uuidutils instead of uuid.uuid4()

Openstack common has a wrapper for generating uuids.
We should only use that function when generating
uuids for consistency.

Change-Id: I54315bf67c9625ca575f745b119df9e994681042
Closes-Bug: #1082248

commit_message:
[sec-guide] Elaborating on QoSaaS

Also adds updates for traffic shaping through
DSCP markings, rate-limiting on a per
port/network/tenant basis, port mirroring (through open
source or third-party plug-ins) and flow analysis (through
open source or third-party plug-ins).

Closes-bug: 1447743

Implements: blueprint sec-guide-overhaul

Change-Id: Ibb88fc4b7f660dca5f1d417bf8144052867dc65f

subject: Enable streaming responses in download_image
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-03-02 20:46:26.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/image/v2/image.py', 'openstack/image/v2/_proxy.py', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'openstack/tests/unit/image/v2/test_image.py', 'doc/source/users/guides/image.rst'], 'message': 'Enable streaming responses in download_image

Previously, the openstack.image.image_download method would place the
contents of a remote image into a Python variable.  With this change,
the download_image method can optionally return the
requests.Response object returned by session.get(), which permits
the caller to download the image in chunks using the iter_content
method.  This can prevent performance issues when dealing with
large images.

Change-Id: Ie62ebcc895ca893321a10def18ac5d74c7c843b9
'}]
commit_message:
Enable streaming responses in download_image

Previously, the openstack.image.image_download method would place the
contents of a remote image into a Python variable.  With this change,
the download_image method can optionally return the
requests.Response object returned by session.get(), which permits
the caller to download the image in chunks using the iter_content
method.  This can prevent performance issues when dealing with
large images.

Change-Id: Ie62ebcc895ca893321a10def18ac5d74c7c843b9

subject: libvirt: handle os-brick InvalidConnectorProtocol on init
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 9732, 'name': 'Mellanox CI', 'email': 'mlnx-openstack-ci@dev.mellanox.co.il', 'username': 'mellanox', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10135, 'name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'display_name': 'Lee Yarwood', 'email': 'lyarwood@redhat.com', 'username': 'lyarwood'}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11303, 'name': 'Markus Zoeller (markus_z)', 'email': 'mzoeller@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'mzoeller'}, {'_account_id': 11805, 'name': 'Corey Bryant', 'email': 'corey.bryant@canonical.com', 'username': 'coreycb'}, {'_account_id': 16128, 'name': 'IBM PowerVM CI', 'email': 'powervmci@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powervmci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16376, 'name': 'Intel NFV CI', 'email': 'openstack-nfv-ci@intel.com', 'username': 'intel-nfv-ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 20040, 'name': 'Microsoft Hyper-V Compute CI', 'email': 'microsoft_nova_ci@microsoft.com', 'username': 'microsoft_nova_ci'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-03 20:28:45.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/test_driver.py', 'nova/virt/driver.py', 'nova/tests/unit/virt/libvirt/test_driver.py'], 'message': "libvirt: handle os-brick InvalidConnectorProtocol on init

On init the LibvirtDriver imports it's volume drivers into
a registry for later access during volume operations. Several
of the libvirt volume drivers are using os-brick for the connector.
os-brick can raise an exception when loading a connector class
under certain conditions, e.g. s390x + ISER is not a supported
mapping in os-brick. This in turn causes the LibvirtDriver to
fail to load which causes nova-compute to crash.

This change handles the os-brick specific InvalidConnectorProtocol
exception when importing volume drivers, logs a debug message but
doesn't fail to init the LibvirtDriver.

As part of this change the driver_dict_from_config helper method
is integrated with the _get_volume_drivers method as that was
the only thing using it, and it's cleaner if those are just a
single method.

Depends-On: I7183a479bc12c4e5509f52bf7fdd0fa7ccaa7247

Change-Id: I61376469a409dc5475886e6c79486b815129392a
Closes-Bug: #1639239
(cherry picked from commit 57f46c1c28a2e3ba1f12ec8f883cf99ccd9979db)
"}]
commit_message:
libvirt: handle os-brick InvalidConnectorProtocol on init

On init the LibvirtDriver imports it's volume drivers into
a registry for later access during volume operations. Several
of the libvirt volume drivers are using os-brick for the connector.
os-brick can raise an exception when loading a connector class
under certain conditions, e.g. s390x + ISER is not a supported
mapping in os-brick. This in turn causes the LibvirtDriver to
fail to load which causes nova-compute to crash.

This change handles the os-brick specific InvalidConnectorProtocol
exception when importing volume drivers, logs a debug message but
doesn't fail to init the LibvirtDriver.

As part of this change the driver_dict_from_config helper method
is integrated with the _get_volume_drivers method as that was
the only thing using it, and it's cleaner if those are just a
single method.

Depends-On: I7183a479bc12c4e5509f52bf7fdd0fa7ccaa7247

Change-Id: I61376469a409dc5475886e6c79486b815129392a
Closes-Bug: #1639239
(cherry picked from commit 57f46c1c28a2e3ba1f12ec8f883cf99ccd9979db)

subject: Modify variable's usage in Log Messages
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-11 14:24:31.000000000', 'files': ['rally/task/hook.py'], 'message': "Modify variable's usage in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging
code, rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/
oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages
For example:
WRONG:  LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
RIGHT:  LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I44b21cc627f19adbce62d6ae57218064b61d4676
"}]
commit_message:
Modify variable's usage in Log Messages

String interpolation should be delayed to be handled by the logging
code, rather than being done at the point of the logging call.
Ref:http://docs.openstack.org/developer/
oslo.i18n/guidelines.html#adding-variables-to-log-messages
For example:
WRONG:  LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s') % variable)
RIGHT:  LOG.info(_LI('some message: variable=%s'), variable)

Change-Id: I44b21cc627f19adbce62d6ae57218064b61d4676

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-09 09:04:51.000000000', 'files': ['neutronclient/tests/unit/osc/v2/fwaas/test_firewallpolicy.py', 'neutronclient/osc/v2/fwaas/firewallpolicy.py'], 'message': 'Order Firewall rules in Firewall policy

Currently the firewall rules are sorted when updating
firewall policy. This may not affect the backend driver,
but does influence the user as the user may be confused in

Change-Id: Ic209e6f65afc79bd5cb7eb9ce8e744b9b1bc8043
Closes-Bug: #bug/1671338
'}]
commit_message:
Order Firewall rules in Firewall policy

Currently the firewall rules are sorted when updating
firewall policy. This may not affect the backend driver,
but does influence the user as the user may be confused in
what order are the rules applied. This patch fixes the same.

Change-Id: Ic209e6f65afc79bd5cb7eb9ce8e744b9b1bc8043
Closes-Bug: #bug/1671338

subject: Provide available physical networks on create network modal
revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2017-03-10 16:57:07.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/networks/forms.py', 'doc/source/topics/settings.rst', 'openstack_dashboard/dashboards/admin/networks/tests.py', 'openstack_dashboard/local/local_settings.py.example'], 'message': "Provide available physical networks on create network modal

Added setting physical_networks to provide users list of
available physical networks to choose from on the
admin create network modal.

Default to an empty list and the physical network field is
a regular input field where users can type in the name
of the physical network to be used.

If it's set to a list of physical network names, the
physical network field is a dropdown menu where users can
choose a physical network to use.

Closes-bug: #1485144

Change-Id: I342b3776a52179d5b4a704fb984912878ff3dc81
"}]
commit_message:
Provide available physical networks on create network modal

Added setting physical_networks to provide users list of
available physical networks to choose from on the
admin create network modal.

Default to an empty list and the physical network field is
a regular input field where users can type in the name
of the physical network to be used.

If it's set to a list of physical network names, the
physical network field is a dropdown menu where users can
choose a physical network to use.

Closes-bug: #1485144

Change-Id: I342b3776a52179d5b4a704fb984912878ff3dc81

commit_message:
create swift user after installing ceilometer package

When configuring ceilometer middleware in Swift, we need the ceilometer
package first to have the ceilometer user before trying to create the
swift user because we add the swift user to the ceilometer group.

Change-Id: I2be3f693f11a7c41b0c198cb24420e53b057f338

commit_message:
Inconsistent package_ensure parameter name

The parameter name used to enforce package state is inconsistent across
manifests and modules. I settle on package_ensure since it's already
widely used.

Change-Id: If11b95ddb6b6748d587d96dcad522d96fd58a91d
Closes-Bug: #1668732

Related the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412766

This patch addresses:

- Cleanup stdin, stdout sequence which can be maintained by just
  dict map rather than if/elif/else for each supported language
  at main() in storlet/tools/deploy_storlet.py

- Add basic unit tests for deploy_storlet (no error test cases exist with this)

- Make mixin class at tests/functional/common/mixins.py to avoid

Change-Id: I6098954a0abcc57314b6f4d0af3efa5d373ad37c

commit_message:
Cleanup deploy_storlet and the tests

Related the patch https://review.openstack.org/#/c/412766

This patch addresses:

- Cleanup stdin, stdout sequence which can be maintained by just
  dict map rather than if/elif/else for each supported language
  at main() in storlet/tools/deploy_storlet.py

- Add basic unit tests for deploy_storlet (no error test cases exist with this)

- Make mixin class at tests/functional/common/mixins.py to avoid
  redandant copy/paste code for java/python functional tests

Change-Id: I6098954a0abcc57314b6f4d0af3efa5d373ad37c

commit_message:
Use generic keystone client instead of versioned

This will allow the usage of versionless keystone endpoints. However,
the versioned ones still work, as the generic client uses keystone
discovery to determine the version to use.

Change-Id: I6d66c1b80b79fa1dcb31fbd3c165e4fca6940414

commit_message:
Switch to use stable data_utils

Tempest provides stable library interfaces under tempest.lib.
This patch switches to use it for data_utils.

NOTE: Maybe reviewers will feel deja-vu because the similar patch is
      merged before. But ater that, the another copying tempest patch
      has been merged and we need this patch again. Sorry for this mess.
      Iba05bc604f447f2acaf4cd81e05443b366b821a1 will be merged after
      all projects are ready.

Change-Id: I1dd56c95c0bf69d4f52402399631bb01d5ee5702

commit_message:
Pass network_mask_bits in assign_static_ip()

Tempest patch (I430424cc776cb12906c7890cf584797ebea1cd41)
removing the dependency of config value of network_mask_bits
in remote_client assign_static_ip() method.

User of this method needs to pass the network_mask_bits explicitly as arg.

Change-Id: I87f420af25e30f31be34495e1a859802b53cceea
Depends-On: I430424cc776cb12906c7890cf584797ebea1cd41
(cherry picked from commit 125b4a71d127d1abd3159119660e5159c2da10ae)

test.call_until_true has been deprecated since Newton on Tempest side,
and now Tempest provides test_utils.call_until_true as the stable
library method. So this patch switches to use the stable method before

Don't use Tempest internal methods

All changed methods are clearly internal methods of Tempest, and the
Tempest commit 64e6b4457c748f74bfb4fbf3860ab65b65ae9beb has removed
the internal methods and now the gate issue happens.
This patch makes this project to use better ones instead.

Related-Bug: #1667824
"}]
commit_message:
Switch to use test_utils.call_until_true

test.call_until_true has been deprecated since Newton on Tempest side,
and now Tempest provides test_utils.call_until_true as the stable
library method. So this patch switches to use the stable method before
removing old test.call_until_true on Tempest side.

Change-Id: I30bc8a18aafb1822896e5b3b67b080e06c7e308f
Needed-by: Ide11a7434a4714e5d2211af1803333535f557370

Don't use Tempest internal methods

All changed methods are clearly internal methods of Tempest, and the
Tempest commit 64e6b4457c748f74bfb4fbf3860ab65b65ae9beb has removed
the internal methods and now the gate issue happens.
This patch makes this project to use better ones instead.

Change-Id: I736a0099510a4ad6d1cb7ed4c2510c961de95b15
Related-Bug: #1667824

commit_message:
Fix order of arguments in assertEqual

Some tests used incorrect order assertEqual(observed, expected).

The correct order expected by testtools is
assertEqual(expected, observed).

commit_message:
Switch to use stable data_utils

Tempest provides stable library interfaces under tempest.lib.
This patch switches to use it for data_utils.

NOTE: Maybe reviewers will feel deja-vu because the similar patch is
      merged before. But ater that, the another copying tempest patch
      has been merged and we need this patch again. Sorry for this mess.
      Iba05bc604f447f2acaf4cd81e05443b366b821a1 will be merged after
      all projects are ready.

Change-Id: I1dd56c95c0bf69d4f52402399631bb01d5ee5702

subject: Retry the git clone in role fetcher
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-09 19:10:53.000000000', 'files': ['tests/get-ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': "Retry the git clone in role fetcher

I see failures in my local CI 10-20% of the time on cloning one or
two roles, so the test fails to bootstrap. I'm not sure if there
is some rate limiting in place on the Openstack git repos, but it
seems to fail quite often on a very reliable link.

The failure being seen is:
Failed to connect to git.openstack.org port 443: No route to host

This patch adds retries to the git clone task used to fetch roles
to hopefully avoid this failure.

Change-Id: I1ea74e3ac4b2d0da88f3155d593eaceb0a205d46
(cherry picked from commit c8606c443c9cbf77043f763973abebc6d7bb3791)
"}]
commit_message:
Retry the git clone in role fetcher

I see failures in my local CI 10-20% of the time on cloning one or
two roles, so the test fails to bootstrap. I'm not sure if there
is some rate limiting in place on the Openstack git repos, but it
seems to fail quite often on a very reliable link.

The failure being seen is:
Failed to connect to git.openstack.org port 443: No route to host

This patch adds retries to the git clone task used to fetch roles
to hopefully avoid this failure.

Change-Id: I1ea74e3ac4b2d0da88f3155d593eaceb0a205d46
(cherry picked from commit c8606c443c9cbf77043f763973abebc6d7bb3791)

revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2017-03-11 19:12:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/compute/cells_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_api.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/compute/api.py'], 'message': 'No API cell up-call to delete consoleauth tokens

One goal of Cells v2 is to remove all up-calls from compute to API
cells.  This change removes the up-call to delete consoleauth tokens
during instance deletion and live migration.  Instead, the tokens are
deleted near the start of these processes in the API cell.  To close
the loop, new consoleauth tokens are not granted to instances in
deleting or migrating task states.

Change-Id: Ic7c68b75e22bad2b0237a2f861254611a86516f3
'}]
commit_message:
No API cell up-call to delete consoleauth tokens

One goal of Cells v2 is to remove all up-calls from compute to API
cells.  This change removes the up-call to delete consoleauth tokens
during instance deletion and live migration.  Instead, the tokens are
deleted near the start of these processes in the API cell.  To close
the loop, new consoleauth tokens are not granted to instances in
deleting or migrating task states.

Change-Id: Ic7c68b75e22bad2b0237a2f861254611a86516f3

subject: Add tables contributed by atomic rules
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-11 19:24:41.000000000', 'files': ['congress/datalog/base.py', 'congress/policy_engines/agnostic.py'], 'message': 'Add tables contributed by atomic rules

datalog/* fail to consider tables contributed by atomic rules,
leading to the problem that user cannot list rows from the
policy table.

This change adds the tables contributed by atomic rules.
This patch is a quick fix intended to have minimal risk
of disrupting other things (for example by introducing a new
optional argument for new behavior). More permanent fix is
needed that respects the abstractions intended by
congress/datalog/*.

Closes-Bug: 1658263

Change-Id: Ie0fd108ebcae01b1f136ff7e859e25b5253a788d
(cherry picked from commit cfecb039b9b20aaa6bdd775cf9821f058eb99c37)
'}]
commit_message:
Add tables contributed by atomic rules

datalog/* fail to consider tables contributed by atomic rules,
leading to the problem that user cannot list rows from the
policy table.

This change adds the tables contributed by atomic rules.
This patch is a quick fix intended to have minimal risk
of disrupting other things (for example by introducing a new
optional argument for new behavior). More permanent fix is
needed that respects the abstractions intended by
congress/datalog/*.

Closes-Bug: 1658263

Change-Id: Ie0fd108ebcae01b1f136ff7e859e25b5253a788d
(cherry picked from commit cfecb039b9b20aaa6bdd775cf9821f058eb99c37)

As per TC requirements, all channels in the #openstack-* freenode
namespace should be logged via OpenStack Infrastructure.

There seems to be a general consensus (although not total agreement)
that a openstack-deployment IRC channel would be benefecial for
cross-project collaboration between various deployment tool teams.

commit_message:
Add #openstack-deployment channel to logging

As per TC requirements, all channels in the #openstack-* freenode
namespace should be logged via OpenStack Infrastructure.

There seems to be a general consensus (although not total agreement)
that a openstack-deployment IRC channel would be benefecial for
cross-project collaboration between various deployment tool teams.

The channel has already been created and is in limited initial use.
To meet the TC requirements, this review is submitted for logging
purposes.

Reference:
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2017-February/112960.html

Change-Id: Ia688174292383144da4885596d332c7800e8f353

commit_message:
Remove Linux SMBFS driver

This driver has been deprecated in Ocata and is now being removed.

Note that the Windows SMBFS driver was inheriting it so we're pulling
in the common logic.

Change-Id: I3dd8ceb042223402bfc29050f74ad3672badf816

There is a bug 1640283 fixed in OVS 2.5.1 but currently we ship Neutron

commit_message:
functional: Stop compiling OVS from source

There is a bug 1640283 fixed in OVS 2.5.1 but currently we ship Neutron
with openvswitch 2.5.0. The patch adds a decorator that skips particular
tests in case minimal version requirement is not met.

Mitaka changes: test case not skipped because there is no such test case
in the branch.

Change-Id: I3a665f3ba770e4acad7e7ead3f8cc557a86952cf
(cherry picked from commit 7210696702493736ea3d203fa13bb13012207632)

commit_message:
Use oslo.db for sqla driver

Use create_engine in oslo.db instead of the sqlalchemy one to get
the optimization benefit from oslo.db.

Breaking change would be replacing database.url with
database.connection therefore database.url will be still
supported until Pike is released. database.url
has been marked as deprecated option.

Change-Id: Id3cdafa791a7d2558a5b065022a9afc6ff31e004
Closes-bug: #1640419

subject: [CI] skip some resources while checking cleanup
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2017-03-11 09:28:42.000000000', 'files': ['tests/ci/osresources.py'], 'message': '[CI] skip some resources while checking cleanup

 * cinder cache volumes - these resources are created by Cinder API
   itself;
 * nova images - actually, it is a proxy to glance. We should list
   such resources via glanceclient
 * nova networks, floating ips, security groups. In case when Neutron
   is enabled, Nova-API works like a proxy, so we do not need to try
   list resources in this case.

Change-Id: Ie65f3be448c837e00b2c360b547430704b89ccdb
'}]
commit_message:
[CI] skip some resources while checking cleanup

 * cinder cache volumes - these resources are created by Cinder API
   itself;
 * nova images - actually, it is a proxy to glance. We should list
   such resources via glanceclient
 * nova networks, floating ips, security groups. In case when Neutron
   is enabled, Nova-API works like a proxy, so we do not need to try
   list resources in this case.

Change-Id: Ie65f3be448c837e00b2c360b547430704b89ccdb

subject: Fix port update for service subnets
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-10 15:31:32.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/extensions/test_subnet_service_types.py', 'neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py'], 'message': "Fix port update for service subnets

Updating a port's fixed_ips will currently fail for a subnet that has
a service type, regardless of whether the port has a matching
device_owner. This is because _update_ips_for_port in
ipam_pluggable_backend.py does not take the device_owner into account
when calling _ipam_get_subnets.

This patch fixes the bug by passing the port's device_owner to
_ipam_get_subnets in _update_ips_for_port, and includes a new unit
test to prevent future regressions.

Change-Id: I09ac773ae27eebe104d5c39e1e8863c02880f85d
Closes-Bug: #1660607
(cherry picked from commit b61b630f0b8e620b218a29d72a250382e07055c1)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix port update for service subnets

Updating a port's fixed_ips will currently fail for a subnet that has
a service type, regardless of whether the port has a matching
device_owner. This is because _update_ips_for_port in
ipam_pluggable_backend.py does not take the device_owner into account
when calling _ipam_get_subnets.

This patch fixes the bug by passing the port's device_owner to
_ipam_get_subnets in _update_ips_for_port, and includes a new unit
test to prevent future regressions.

Change-Id: I09ac773ae27eebe104d5c39e1e8863c02880f85d
Closes-Bug: #1660607
(cherry picked from commit b61b630f0b8e620b218a29d72a250382e07055c1)

subject: Changed the derived type of "tosca.nodes.SomeApp"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-03-03 13:19:15.000000000', 'files': ['toscaparser/tests/data/topology_template/definitions.yaml'], 'message': 'Changed the derived type of "tosca.nodes.SomeApp"

The node template "app" (that is the one instantiating
"example.SomeApp" in the topology) is connected to the node "websrv",
which is of type "tosca.nodes.WebServer", which is not a valid target
 for the requirement "host".

We fixed the definition of the type "example.SomeApp" to derive "example.SomeApp" from "tosca.nodes.WebApplication", whose "host"
requirement has to be satisfied by a "tosca.nodes.WebServer".

Change-Id: I16e697bcd9f1728df1d0b18595fdb4a703f41d26
Closes-bug: #1663681
'}]
commit_message:
Changed the derived type of "tosca.nodes.SomeApp"

The node template "app" (that is the one instantiating
"example.SomeApp" in the topology) is connected to the node "websrv",
which is of type "tosca.nodes.WebServer", which is not a valid target
 for the requirement "host".

We fixed the definition of the type "example.SomeApp" to derive "example.SomeApp" from "tosca.nodes.WebApplication", whose "host"
requirement has to be satisfied by a "tosca.nodes.WebServer".

Change-Id: I16e697bcd9f1728df1d0b18595fdb4a703f41d26
Closes-bug: #1663681

commit_message:
Return the exit code of the executed command

On the container exec command, return the same exit code of
the command being executed in the container. This would be
useful for users to retrieve the exit code as they did in
Docker CLI.

Change-Id: I2aa0b4d9e7994a125f54e93d36efc854db66fe25
Depends-On: I20cc48da20bdc3784ec8fce4e38a98baf388a0ca
Closes-Bug: #1645044

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-10 22:32:25.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/network/v2/flavor.py', 'openstack/tests/functional/network/v2/test_flavor.py'], 'message': 'Fix the network flavor disassociate method

This test probably passed when we were using our own session
or the keystoneauth session changed at some point.  Anyway, I
think it makes sense to have this method to return None on
success.  The delete method will throw an exception on failure.

Change-Id: I4213724380d189e44f3fec05b7d8065a6419b452

'}]
commit_message:
Fix the network flavor disassociate method

This test probably passed when we were using our own session
or the keystoneauth session changed at some point.  Anyway, I
think it makes sense to have this method to return None on
success.  The delete method will throw an exception on failure.

Change-Id: I4213724380d189e44f3fec05b7d8065a6419b452
Partial-bug: #1665495

commit_message:
Remove base element

The base element was a loose collection of unspecified
things. These things are outdated, not used or were
/ should moved to specific elements.
It was also not possible to include the base element
in an init-less images e.g. used as a container.

Tested locally: fedora-24, fedora-25, debian-jessie,
debian-strech, gentoo, ubuntu-trusty, ubuntu-xenial,
ubuntu-yakkety (all -minimal variants).

Change-Id: Ied571c5c908f3a3aaae12952f76687a1fdf68d7d
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

subject: Replace architecture-emulation-binaries with qemu-debootstrap
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-11 13:56:00.000000000', 'files': ['diskimage_builder/elements/architecture-emulation-binaries/cleanup.d/01-cleanbinary', 'diskimage_builder/elements/architecture-emulation-binaries/extra-data.d/01-copy-binary', 'diskimage_builder/elements/architecture-emulation-binaries/README.rst', 'diskimage_builder/elements/debootstrap/root.d/08-debootstrap'], 'message': 'Replace architecture-emulation-binaries with qemu-debootstrap

The architecture-emulation-binaries element does for a limited number
of architectures on Ubuntu exactly the same as `qemu-debootstrap`.
`qemu-debootstrap` comes in the qemu-user-static package that is
anyhow used when cross-building an image.

This patch replaces the complete architecture-emulation-binaries
element with a call to qemu-debootstrap.

Change-Id: I7934fe798b9dd34df073c43778c3cc5cdfd874bf
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
'}]
commit_message:
Replace architecture-emulation-binaries with qemu-debootstrap

The architecture-emulation-binaries element does for a limited number
of architectures on Ubuntu exactly the same as `qemu-debootstrap`.
`qemu-debootstrap` comes in the qemu-user-static package that is
anyhow used when cross-building an image.

This patch replaces the complete architecture-emulation-binaries
element with a call to qemu-debootstrap.

Change-Id: I7934fe798b9dd34df073c43778c3cc5cdfd874bf
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>

commit_message:
Refactor: block-device filesystem creation, mount and fstab

This patch finalizes the block device refactoring.  It moves the three
remaining levels (filesystem creation, mount and fstab handling) into
the new python module.

Now it is possible to use any number of disk images, any number of
partitions and used them mounted to different directories.

Change-Id: Ic5b7c7d2c6f4df68f6869fc320011c25d3029887
Signed-off-by: Andreas Florath <andreas@florath.net>
Closes-Bug: #1664924

commit_message:
rabbitmq/messaging: Use new standard TLS params

The parameters for drivers in oslo.messaging are being standardized [1].
And part of this is also the sandarization of the TLS-related
parameters. As per a recent commit [2], the rabbitmq configuration
parameters have changed and the old names are being deprecated (although
they still work). This patch reflects that.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/common_driver_config
[2] Ic32b2cb253fa0dc43aad7226b24919b7e588faa9

Change-Id: I8d41ec4e1a7bca3d114286a034f663c2a2c9b8d7

revisions:

"}]
commit_message:
rabbitmq SSL: check puppet resource instead of actual config

The configuration is done via the oslo::messaging::rabbit resource
from puppet-oslo. We should be checking for the resource that we're
using instead of the underlying configuration file.

Change-Id: I7d24d4bd2b77ef3dff8bb8ad703938399681573a

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-03-11 04:39:11.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'Added the py35 env

The gating on python 3.4 is restricted to <= Mitaka.
